newsitem.title: USA: Campbell to cut NJ staff, sell Swanson-paper.
newsitem.headline: Campbell to cut NJ staff, sell Swanson-paper.

text.p: Campbell Soup Co is planning to reduce its presence in Camden, the city where it was founded a century ago, the Philadelphia Inquirer reported on Wednesday.

Citing company sources and Wall Street analysts, the newspaper reported that Campbell plans to shrink its headquarters staff of 1,500, close one of four major soup plants and divest some brand names including Swanson frozen foods.
A company spokesman called the report speculative but did not deny it.
